item.title: Street labels are displayed in a weird way at tile boundaries
item.description:
From uzemelt...@gmail.com on May 17, 2012 22:13:52
*What steps will reproduce the problem?
I use a modified osmarender.xml, besides that I did not alter the rendering code.
*What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
Some street names get fragmented or overlap. (See attachment.) E.g.: _2208.png should display "Raoul Wallenberg utca" Looks like clipped labels behave in a strange way at tile boundaries.
*What version of the product are you using? On what operating system?
0.3.0, Android 2.2
Attachment: screenshot_2012-05-17_2207.png screenshot_2012-05-17_2207_1.png screenshot_2012-05-17_2208.png osmarender.xml
Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=314

item.contents:
From uzemelt...@gmail.com on May 18, 2012 13:29:46
Well, to be honest I don't exactly know what "cache persistence" means... anyway, I guess it means that the .tile files don't get deleted when I exit the app.
If that's the case, then it's definitely not activated, as I checked that all .tile files vanish on exit.
